BY ROAD- Less than 2 miles from Junctions 6 & 7 of the M4, to the south, and 6 miles from Junction 2 of the M40, which provide excellent access to the M25, Heathrow Airport & the wider national motorway network BY RAIL- Slough and Burnham Railway stations within 3 miles, providing fast and direct rail access. There is a dedicated bus service to Slough and Burnham train stations from the Slough Trading Estate. BY AIR- Proximity to Heathrow Airport, the UK’s largest cargo terminal.

displayAddress: Units 4 & 5, Reading Trade Centre, Rose Kiln Lane, Reading  RG2 0JZ
detailedDescription: Unit 4 - 4,115 sq. ft Unit 5 - 4,133 sq. ft Total - 8,248 sq. ft Units 4 & 5 offer refurbished trade counter / warehouse accommodation with partially glazed frontage, allocated parking and designated loading bays designed specifically for the trade and roadside market. The units are of steel portal frame construction under a pitched insulated roof with profiled metal cladding. The planning use of the building is for B8 (warehousing) with ancillary trade counter use. The units are available now either combined or individually.  Location: Reading Trade Centre is prominently positioned on the busy A33 Reading Relief Road (Rose Kiln Lane) approximately 2 miles from both the M4, Junction 11, and Reading Town Centre. Reading Station is located 1.3 miles to the north of the scheme. On a prime pitch at the heart of the A33 corridor, the area has a large number of trade, car showroom, self storage and retail operators. With excellent accessibility and a high volume of passing traffic, local occupiers include Skoda, Honda, Big Yellow, Magnet, Porcelanosa, Home Bargains, Matalan and Harveys.
